oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Schools; Automobiles; Pines
York, Alvin Cullum, 1887-1964; World War, 1914-1918 -- Tennessee -- History;Motion pictures; Agricultural high schools; Technical schools; Jamestown (Tenn.); Alvin C. York Agricultural Institute
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Stand of pine trees in front of the York Agricultural Institute, showing the front of the school building and vehicles parked in the drive.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Albert F. Ganier
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pall Mall in Fentress County was Alvin York's hometown. Photographs were taken during a series of meetings between York and Hollywood producers related to a proposed film based on his World War I exploits. York founded the school in 1926 and it continues to be operated by the state. The school's newspaper bears the name "Pine Needles" after the pine trees on the grounds.
